lines.text:
[sticking thermometer in Gurney's mouth]
Keep your mouth shut.
Hey, d'ya year that? That's a hot one. First time anybody ever told me to keep my mouth shut and got away with it.
I suppose that's something to boast about.

You bet it is! Hey Doc... anybody ever tell you that you're a pretty good lookin' doll? Ah, I'm not kiddin'. Y'know, I don't go for dolls as a rule. I mean, they're just something nice to have around the house like cats and dogs and pets and things. You got brains.
Yeah, I'm different.
Sure, we could get along swell together if you'd just relax.

[after receiving care for a gunshot wound]
Well, can I take it or can I take it?
You can take it. Some people aren't sensitive to pain, especially moronic types.
Hey, did you hear that, Slick? I'm a moronic type.
Yeah? Hey, what's that?
I don't know. Some type of medical name, ain't it doc?
What you want is a ghost writer.
Nah no mystery stuff, just plain facts.

[after being shot]
Where's my writer?
I'm here, Joe.
I guess you'll have to finish my book without me.
The finish was written long ago.
What do you want with me, Joe?

Well, I tell yuh, me and the boys are takin' a bit of a layoff while the pressure's on, and I got thinkin' about that book you wrote, you know, on Napoleon. Figured that him and me bein' so much alike, you'd like to do a little job for me.
What kind of job?
Well, every big man, you know, oughta have somebody to write his auto... uh, auto...
[unsure of the word]
Autobiography?
Yeah, that's it.
An autobiography is the story of a man's life written by himself.
Well, I knew that, but I got too many things on my mind to write, so I thought maybe you'd front for me.
What you want is a ghost writer.

[Obviously misunderstanding]
No mystery stuff! Just plain facts. How does it sound to you?
I still have two weeks to convince the medical board that I'm innocent, and until that time I'm a licensed doctor!

[Self-righteously]
But, you have no call to start up in a respectable town like this. If the sheriff did his duty, you'd be locked up in a cell!
If the state did its duty, YOU'd be locked up in a cell - a padded cell!
[the sheriff explodes in laughter]

[Shocked that Gurney has shot one of his own men in the back]
What yuh wanna do that for?

[as he looks dispassionately through the holes in his revolver and casually blows out dirt]
It says in the book that Napoleon said a good general has got to know when to be just, severe, - or mild.

[Entering the doctor's office]
Dr. Nelson?
That's right.

[Taking in the doctor's shabby office]
I don't get it.
Whatta yuh mean?
A guy with a pair of million dollar hands in a dump like this!
Oh?
Yeah! You're wastin' your time down here. You oughta be uptown with the big dough.
You're putting your head right in the lion's mouth.
That's what I've got to do.

[after being told by Gurney to come back with a typewriter]
Hey, boss, where am I gonna pick up a typewriter at this time of the night? The stores are all closed!
Well, open one!
